message: Interesting

Adam...freedom of speech MUST by definition include the most vile hate speech. If you limit someone else's speech in potentia you make a rod for your own back. I would however say calling for murder is probably the fine line even I would draw. But you must draw that line very solidly and not extend it. I find Geert Wilders despicable but have yet to see anything that I wouldn't defend his right to say...because that also defends my right to tear his view down. The ONLY way good ideas can win, and they must win, is if we solidly defend free speech for all. Because if we don't people get lazy, they hide behind the law, they forget their facts and then the only ones who know the facts are those speaking the most despicable filth...and that gives them power and prevents us defeating their views.
How many did we kill? Not enough. He thinks Michael Moore movies are true. Oh my God these people are stupid.

10104261156081125 Actually, Reagan's best acting job was the 8 years in the White House. He gave the appearance of being presidential saying words written by others in a """"folksy"""" manner - all the while making deals with Iran to delay the release of the hostages; selling weapons to Iran in violation of U.S. law; stealing the proceeds of the illegal weapon sales and giving it to terrorists in Central America in violation of U.S. law; doubling the national debt with tax cuts and outrageous military spending; destroying the middle-class with """"trickle down"""" economics; nearly destroying the Savings & Loan industry with deregulation and no oversight; and fostering the """"junk bond"""" industry and it's devastation of jobs and industries with """"leveraged buyouts"""".
